metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8610 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A denial of service flaw was found in OpenSSL 0.9.8, 1.0.1, 1.0.2 through 1.0.2h, and 1.1.0 in the way the TLS/SSL protocol defined processing of ALERT packets during a connection handshake. A remote attacker could use this flaw to make a TLS/SSL server consume an excessive amount of CPU and fail to accept connections from other clients.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8610` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
guile-gnutls - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutls30 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.6
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.10-4ubuntu1.2').
openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.6').
